sentences.en: A man used to vicissitudes is not easily dejected.
Everyone has days when they feel dejected or down.
sentences.cn: 每个人都有沮丧失意或情绪低落的时候。

sentences.en: Everything was bowed down, dejected , oppressed, and broken.
sentences.cn: 各样东西都垂头丧气, 窒闷, 破败.

sentences.en: He seemed very dejected at his repeated failures.
sentences.cn: 一连串的失败,使他灰溜溜的.

sentences.en: I was the most dejected, disconsolate creature alive.
sentences.cn: 我是世界上最沮丧的 、 最忧郁的人.

sentences.en: Peter was dejected his confidence in tatters.
sentences.cn: 彼得精神沮丧,信心皆无.

sentences.en: Peter was dejected,his confidence in tatters.
sentences.cn: 彼得精神沮丧，信心皆无。

sentences.en: She looked so dejected when she lost the game.
sentences.cn: 她输掉比赛时情绪显得非常低落。
她看上去又悲伤又沮丧.

sentences.en: She was faint with strife and dejected.
sentences.cn: 她被争吵弄得精疲力竭,情绪低落.

sentences.en: The unemployed stood at street corners, dejected.
sentences.cn: 失业者沮丧地站在街角。

sentences.en: They'd been a dejected lot when he'd arrived at the shipyard, but now they sparkled with enthusiasm.
sentences.cn: 他刚到船厂时，他们曾是一群垂头丧气的人，现在的他们却热情洋溢。

sentences.en: We went to bed greatly dejected.
sentences.cn: 我们睡觉的时候,都非常伤心.

sentences.en: Why is she looking so dejected, in such low spirits?
sentences.cn: 她为什么神情如此沮丧?
